task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application so subsequent UI actions target the correct window.
Capture the current UI to discover menus and controls (required before interacting).
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (KB instructs to use Mode → Batch processing).
Allow the Mode menu to open and the UI to update before inspecting options.
Read the Mode menu contents to locate the Batch processing entry.
Switch the application into Batch processing mode so multiple files can be concatenated (KB: set_mode_batch_processing).
Give the application time to switch modes and render the Batch processing UI.
Discover Batch processing view controls (Add files, operation selector, Start/Save button, etc.).

Open the file selection dialog to add multiple MF4 files for batch operations (KB: batch_concatenate_files). If this control is not present, the following File → Open sequence will be used as a fallback.
Wait for the file-open dialog to appear (or for the UI to remain unchanged if Add files isn't present).
Detect whether a file-open dialog appeared; capture its controls (File name edit, Open button, file list).
Focus the File name edit in the file-open dialog so we can navigate directly to the target folder (recommended approach from open_files KB: enter folder path then press Enter).
Enter the exact folder path specified by the user and press Enter to open it in the file dialog (learning from open_files: use the exact folder path and press Enter).
Allow the dialog to navigate to the specified folder and populate the file list.
Capture the file list contents to locate at least one .MF4 file to select (required before clicking file list entries).
Select one .MF4 file in the folder (per open_files KB guidance: select any one file before Ctrl+A to select all).
Select all files in the folder (Ctrl+A) to include all .MF4 files in the batch load, as recommended in the open_files learning.
Confirm the selection and load all selected MF4 files into the Batch processing list (KB: open_files).
Wait for the files to be added into the Batch processing list; larger batches may take longer to appear.
Inspect the Batch processing list and controls to set the operation to Concatenate and prepare the output filename.
Select the Concatenate operation from the Batch operations choices so the input files are concatenated into a single continuous measurement (KB: batch_concatenate_files).
Allow the operation selection to register in the UI.
Begin the batch operation which will prompt for an output file name or directly start saving; KB sequence indicates pressing Start/Save after selecting Concatenate.
Wait for the Save dialog to appear (or for the save process to present a File name field).
Detect the Save dialog controls to enter the desired output filename (File name edit and Save button).
Focus the Save dialog File name field so we can type the output path and filename.
Enter the full output path and filename exactly as requested and press Enter to confirm the Save (KB: batch_concatenate_files instructs entering the output filename before saving).
Allow the concatenation and save operation to complete. Duration depends on file sizes; adjust if needed.
Confirm the operation completed successfully and the output file exists (final UI state capture).

Switch asammdf to Batch processing mode (set_mode_batch_processing), add all .MF4 files from the specified folder (open_files guidance: type exact folder path, select one file, Ctrl+A to select all), set the batch operation to Concatenate (batch_concatenate_files) and start the process, then enter the requested output filename and save. Wait steps and repeated State-Tool calls ensure UI updates are captured and controls are available. Fallback: attempted Add files click is followed by File→Open sequence if Add files is not available (open_files learning).
